#Text=( (
#Text=WN
#Text=) )
#Text=Behnke : What is your religious affliation ?
#Text=MD
#Text=: We are Christian .
#Text=We are not Catholic .
#Text=That is a falsehood put out on Wikipedia , and I ’m not sure where that came from .
#Text=I think people just assume that if you have a lot of kids that you are Catholic .
#Text=And there is one nice thing about that , we live right across the street from a very large prominent Catholic Parish called , Our Lady of Mt .

#Text=Carmel , and they have a fall festival every year and so it 's the one place we can go as a family where people do n't give us funny looks because of the number of girls that I have , everybody has a large family in that parish .
#Text=( (
#Text=WN
#Text=) )
#Text=Hello Senator Delph , I ’m Jerrilyn Thompson , and I have a question for you .
#Text=The Sagamore of the Wabash Award , you were awarded that in 2005 .
#Text=And this honorary award is awarded by the Governor .
#Text=And what did you do to get this honor ?
#Text=MD
#Text=: That was something that I was recommended by former Congressman Baron Hill , who represented the southeastern part of the state .
#Text=And I had gotten to know Congressman Hill when I was an executive with Comcast Corporation .
#Text=We actually brought the C-SPAN school bus throughout his district , especially to his hometown of Seymour , Indiana .

#Text=And we had gotten to know each other , and he found out that I had served as an international election observer with the International Republican Institute in Nicaragua in 1996 and then in Mongolia in 2000 .
#Text=And then he had also learned about my service with Congressman Burton and also here in the state of Indiana , and he was gracious to recommend me for that award .
#Text=And then Governor Kernan , before he left office as our governor , was very gracious to award me the Sagamore of the Wabash .
#Text=( (
#Text=WN
#Text=) )
#Text=Thompson : Okay , just a few more questions .
#Text=You had mentioned earlier about the role that Congressman Dan Burton had played in your life , could you please talk a little bit more about that ?
#Text=MD
#Text=: Well certainly .
#Text=He is somebody that was my boss , I ’ve known him for a good chunk of my life .
#Text=When I was thirteen or fourteen , I served as a page for him . When he was an Indiana state senator .
#Text=I had volunteered a little bit on his political campaigns but not a great deal .
#Text=Primarily putting stickers on fire hats in preparation for his parade season .
#Text=But I worked for him from — I want to say — 1996 to 2004 .
#Text=Roughly eight years , give or take .
#Text=I served as a member of his professional staff when he was chairman of the House Committee on Government Reform and Oversight .
#Text=And then I also served as a member of his professional staff , handling a number of different policy areas , including foreign policy and national security policy .
#Text=I covered agricultural issues and environmental policy forum , given some of my academic background .
#Text=But primarily in the national security foreign policy area , primarily focused on anti-narcotics and the drug war .
#Text=I was able to travel — in addition to traveling when I was an international election observer — I was able to travel as a member of his staff to countries like Turkey and Colombia .
